   1 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2 
   3 """
   4 yaspin.yaspin
   5 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   6 
   7 A lightweight terminal spinner.
   8 """
   9 
  10 from __future__ import absolute_import
  11 
  12 import functools
  13 import itertools
  14 import signal
  15 import sys
  16 import threading
  17 import time
  18 
  19 import colorama
  20 from pipenv.vendor.vistir import cursor
  21 
  22 from .base_spinner import default_spinner
  23 from .compat import PY2, basestring, builtin_str, bytes, iteritems, str
  24 from .constants import COLOR_ATTRS, COLOR_MAP, ENCODING, SPINNER_ATTRS
  25 from .helpers import to_unicode
  26 from .termcolor import colored
  27 
  28 
  29 colorama.init()
  30 
  31 
  32 class Yaspin(object):
  33     """Implements a context manager that spawns a thread
  34     to write spinner frames into a tty (stdout) during
  35     context execution.
  36     """
  37 
  38     # When Python finds its output attached to a terminal,
  39     # it sets the sys.stdout.encoding attribute to the terminal's encoding.
  40     # The print statement's handler will automatically encode unicode
  41     # arguments into bytes.
  42     #
  43     # In Py2 when piping or redirecting output, Python does not detect
  44     # the desired character set of the output, it sets sys.stdout.encoding
  45     # to None, and print will invoke the default "ascii" codec.
  46     #
  47     # Py3 invokes "UTF-8" codec by default.
  48     #
  49     # Thats why in Py2, output should be encoded manually with desired
  50     # encoding in order to support pipes and redirects.
  51 
  52     def __init__(
  53         self,
  54         spinner=None,
  55         text="",
  56         color=None,
  57         on_color=None,
  58         attrs=None,
  59         reversal=False,
  60         side="left",
  61         sigmap=None,
  62     ):
  63         # Spinner
  64         self._spinner = self._set_spinner(spinner)
  65         self._frames = self._set_frames(self._spinner, reversal)
  66         self._interval = self._set_interval(self._spinner)
  67         self._cycle = self._set_cycle(self._frames)
  68 
  69         # Color Specification
  70         self._color = self._set_color(color) if color else color
  71         self._on_color = self._set_on_color(on_color) if on_color else on_color
  72         self._attrs = self._set_attrs(attrs) if attrs else set()
  73         self._color_func = self._compose_color_func()
  74 
  75         # Other
  76         self._text = self._set_text(text)
  77         self._side = self._set_side(side)
  78         self._reversal = reversal
  79 
  80         # Helper flags
  81         self._stop_spin = None
  82         self._hide_spin = None
  83         self._spin_thread = None
  84         self._last_frame = None
  85         self._stdout_lock = threading.Lock()
  86 
  87         # Signals
  88 
  89         # In Python 2 signal.SIG* are of type int.
  90         # In Python 3 signal.SIG* are enums.
  91         #
  92         # Signal     = Union[enum.Enum, int]
  93         # SigHandler = Union[enum.Enum, Callable]
  94         self._sigmap = sigmap if sigmap else {}  # Dict[Signal, SigHandler]
  95         # Maps signals to their default handlers in order to reset
  96         # custom handlers set by ``sigmap`` at the cleanup phase.
  97         self._dfl_sigmap = {}  # Dict[Signal, SigHandler]
  98 
  99     #
 100     # Dunders
 101     #
 102     def __repr__(self):
 103         repr_ = u"<Yaspin frames={0!s}>".format(self._frames)
 104         if PY2:
 105             return repr_.encode(ENCODING)
 106         return repr_
 107 
 108     def __enter__(self):
 109         self.start()
 110         return self
 111 
 112     def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, traceback):
 113         # Avoid stop() execution for the 2nd time
 114         if self._spin_thread.is_alive():
 115             self.stop()
 116         return False  # nothing is handled
 117 
 118     def __call__(self, fn):
 119         @functools.wraps(fn)
 120         def inner(*args, **kwargs):
 121             with self:
 122                 return fn(*args, **kwargs)
 123 
 124         return inner
 125 
 126     def __getattr__(self, name):
 127         # CLI spinners
 128         if name in SPINNER_ATTRS:
 129             from .spinners import Spinners
 130 
 131             sp = getattr(Spinners, name)
 132             self.spinner = sp
 133         # Color Attributes: "color", "on_color", "attrs"
 134         elif name in COLOR_ATTRS:
 135             attr_type = COLOR_MAP[name]
 136             # Call appropriate property setters;
 137             # _color_func is updated automatically by setters.
 138             if attr_type == "attrs":
 139                 self.attrs = [name]  # calls property setter
 140             if attr_type in ("color", "on_color"):
 141                 setattr(self, attr_type, name)  # calls property setter
 142         # Side: "left" or "right"
 143         elif name in ("left", "right"):
 144             self.side = name  # calls property setter
 145         # Common error for unsupported attributes
 146         else:
 147             raise AttributeError(
 148                 "'{0}' object has no attribute: '{1}'".format(
 149                     self.__class__.__name__, name
 150                 )
 151             )
 152         return self
 153 
 154     #
 155     # Properties
 156     #
 157     @property
 158     def spinner(self):
 159         return self._spinner
 160 
 161     @spinner.setter
 162     def spinner(self, sp):
 163         self._spinner = self._set_spinner(sp)
 164         self._frames = self._set_frames(self._spinner, self._reversal)
 165         self._interval = self._set_interval(self._spinner)
 166         self._cycle = self._set_cycle(self._frames)
 167 
 168     @property
 169     def text(self):
 170         return self._text
 171 
 172     @text.setter
 173     def text(self, txt):
 174         self._text = self._set_text(txt)
 175 
 176     @property
 177     def color(self):
 178         return self._color
 179 
 180     @color.setter
 181     def color(self, value):
 182         self._color = self._set_color(value) if value else value
 183         self._color_func = self._compose_color_func()  # update
 184 
 185     @property
 186     def on_color(self):
 187         return self._on_color
 188 
 189     @on_color.setter
 190     def on_color(self, value):
 191         self._on_color = self._set_on_color(value) if value else value
 192         self._color_func = self._compose_color_func()  # update
 193 
 194     @property
 195     def attrs(self):
 196         return list(self._attrs)
 197 
 198     @attrs.setter
 199     def attrs(self, value):
 200         new_attrs = self._set_attrs(value) if value else set()
 201         self._attrs = self._attrs.union(new_attrs)
 202         self._color_func = self._compose_color_func()  # update
 203 
 204     @property
 205     def side(self):
 206         return self._side
 207 
 208     @side.setter
 209     def side(self, value):
 210         self._side = self._set_side(value)
 211 
 212     @property
 213     def reversal(self):
 214         return self._reversal
 215 
 216     @reversal.setter
 217     def reversal(self, value):
 218         self._reversal = value
 219         self._frames = self._set_frames(self._spinner, self._reversal)
 220         self._cycle = self._set_cycle(self._frames)
 221 
 222     #
 223     # Public
 224     #
 225     def start(self):
 226         if self._sigmap:
 227             self._register_signal_handlers()
 228 
 229         if sys.stdout.isatty():
 230             self._hide_cursor()
 231 
 232         self._stop_spin = threading.Event()
 233         self._hide_spin = threading.Event()
 234         self._spin_thread = threading.Thread(target=self._spin)
 235         self._spin_thread.start()
 236 
 237     def stop(self):
 238         if self._dfl_sigmap:
 239             # Reset registered signal handlers to default ones
 240             self._reset_signal_handlers()
 241 
 242         if self._spin_thread:
 243             self._stop_spin.set()
 244             self._spin_thread.join()
 245 
 246         sys.stdout.write("\r")
 247         self._clear_line()
 248 
 249         if sys.stdout.isatty():
 250             self._show_cursor()
 251 
 252     def hide(self):
 253         """Hide the spinner to allow for custom writing to the terminal."""
 254         thr_is_alive = self._spin_thread and self._spin_thread.is_alive()
 255 
 256         if thr_is_alive and not self._hide_spin.is_set():
 257             with self._stdout_lock:
 258                 # set the hidden spinner flag
 259                 self._hide_spin.set()
 260 
 261                 # clear the current line
 262                 sys.stdout.write("\r")
 263                 self._clear_line()
 264 
 265                 # flush the stdout buffer so the current line
 266                 # can be rewritten to
 267                 sys.stdout.flush()
 268 
 269     def show(self):
 270         """Show the hidden spinner."""
 271         thr_is_alive = self._spin_thread and self._spin_thread.is_alive()
 272 
 273         if thr_is_alive and self._hide_spin.is_set():
 274             with self._stdout_lock:
 275                 # clear the hidden spinner flag
 276                 self._hide_spin.clear()
 277 
 278                 # clear the current line so the spinner is not appended to it
 279                 sys.stdout.write("\r")
 280                 self._clear_line()
 281 
 282     def write(self, text):
 283         """Write text in the terminal without breaking the spinner."""
 284         # similar to tqdm.write()
 285         # https://pypi.python.org/pypi/tqdm#writing-messages
 286         with self._stdout_lock:
 287             sys.stdout.write("\r")
 288             self._clear_line()
 289 
 290             _text = to_unicode(text)
 291             if PY2:
 292                 _text = _text.encode(ENCODING)
 293 
 294             # Ensure output is bytes for Py2 and Unicode for Py3
 295             assert isinstance(_text, builtin_str)
 296 
 297             sys.stdout.write("{0}\n".format(_text))
 298 
 299     def ok(self, text="OK"):
 300         """Set Ok (success) finalizer to a spinner."""
 301         _text = text if text else "OK"
 302         self._freeze(_text)
 303 
 304     def fail(self, text="FAIL"):
 305         """Set fail finalizer to a spinner."""
 306         _text = text if text else "FAIL"
 307         self._freeze(_text)
 308 
 309     #
 310     # Protected
 311     #
 312     def _freeze(self, final_text):
 313         """Stop spinner, compose last frame and 'freeze' it."""
 314         text = to_unicode(final_text)
 315         self._last_frame = self._compose_out(text, mode="last")
 316 
 317         # Should be stopped here, otherwise prints after
 318         # self._freeze call will mess up the spinner
 319         self.stop()
 320         with self._stdout_lock:
 321             sys.stdout.write(self._last_frame)
 322 
 323     def _spin(self):
 324         while not self._stop_spin.is_set():
 325 
 326             if self._hide_spin.is_set():
 327                 # Wait a bit to avoid wasting cycles
 328                 time.sleep(self._interval)
 329                 continue
 330 
 331             # Compose output
 332             spin_phase = next(self._cycle)
 333             out = self._compose_out(spin_phase)
 334 
 335             # Write
 336             with self._stdout_lock:
 337                 sys.stdout.write(out)
 338                 self._clear_line()
 339                 sys.stdout.flush()
 340 
 341             # Wait
 342             time.sleep(self._interval)
 343 
 344     def _compose_color_func(self):
 345         fn = functools.partial(
 346             colored,
 347             color=self._color,
 348             on_color=self._on_color,
 349             attrs=list(self._attrs),
 350         )
 351         return fn
 352 
 353     def _compose_out(self, frame, mode=None):
 354         # Ensure Unicode input
 355         assert isinstance(frame, str)
 356         assert isinstance(self._text, str)
 357 
 358         frame = frame.encode(ENCODING) if PY2 else frame
 359         text = self._text.encode(ENCODING) if PY2 else self._text
 360 
 361         # Colors
 362         if self._color_func is not None:
 363             frame = self._color_func(frame)
 364 
 365         # Position
 366         if self._side == "right":
 367             frame, text = text, frame
 368 
 369         # Mode
 370         if not mode:
 371             out = "\r{0} {1}".format(frame, text)
 372         else:
 373             out = "{0} {1}\n".format(frame, text)
 374 
 375         # Ensure output is bytes for Py2 and Unicode for Py3
 376         assert isinstance(out, builtin_str)
 377 
 378         return out
 379 
 380     def _register_signal_handlers(self):
 381         # SIGKILL cannot be caught or ignored, and the receiving
 382         # process cannot perform any clean-up upon receiving this
 383         # signal.
 384         try:
 385             if signal.SIGKILL in self._sigmap.keys():
 386                 raise ValueError(
 387                     "Trying to set handler for SIGKILL signal. "
 388                     "SIGKILL cannot be cought or ignored in POSIX systems."
 389                 )
 390         except AttributeError:
 391             pass
 392 
 393         for sig, sig_handler in iteritems(self._sigmap):
 394             # A handler for a particular signal, once set, remains
 395             # installed until it is explicitly reset. Store default
 396             # signal handlers for subsequent reset at cleanup phase.
 397             dfl_handler = signal.getsignal(sig)
 398             self._dfl_sigmap[sig] = dfl_handler
 399 
 400             # ``signal.SIG_DFL`` and ``signal.SIG_IGN`` are also valid
 401             # signal handlers and are not callables.
 402             if callable(sig_handler):
 403                 # ``signal.signal`` accepts handler function which is
 404                 # called with two arguments: signal number and the
 405                 # interrupted stack frame. ``functools.partial`` solves
 406                 # the problem of passing spinner instance into the handler
 407                 # function.
 408                 sig_handler = functools.partial(sig_handler, spinner=self)
 409 
 410             signal.signal(sig, sig_handler)
 411 
 412     def _reset_signal_handlers(self):
 413         for sig, sig_handler in iteritems(self._dfl_sigmap):
 414             signal.signal(sig, sig_handler)
 415 
 416     #
 417     # Static
 418     #
 419     @staticmethod
 420     def _set_color(value):
 421         # type: (str) -> str
 422         available_values = [k for k, v in iteritems(COLOR_MAP) if v == "color"]
 423 
 424         if value not in available_values:
 425             raise ValueError(
 426                 "'{0}': unsupported color value. Use one of the: {1}".format(
 427                     value, ", ".join(available_values)
 428                 )
 429             )
 430         return value
 431 
 432     @staticmethod
 433     def _set_on_color(value):
 434         # type: (str) -> str
 435         available_values = [
 436             k for k, v in iteritems(COLOR_MAP) if v == "on_color"
 437         ]
 438         if value not in available_values:
 439             raise ValueError(
 440                 "'{0}': unsupported on_color value. "
 441                 "Use one of the: {1}".format(
 442                     value, ", ".join(available_values)
 443                 )
 444             )
 445         return value
 446 
 447     @staticmethod
 448     def _set_attrs(attrs):
 449         # type: (List[str]) -> Set[str]
 450         available_values = [k for k, v in iteritems(COLOR_MAP) if v == "attrs"]
 451 
 452         for attr in attrs:
 453             if attr not in available_values:
 454                 raise ValueError(
 455                     "'{0}': unsupported attribute value. "
 456                     "Use one of the: {1}".format(
 457                         attr, ", ".join(available_values)
 458                     )
 459                 )
 460         return set(attrs)
 461 
 462     @staticmethod
 463     def _set_spinner(spinner):
 464         if not spinner:
 465             sp = default_spinner
 466 
 467         if hasattr(spinner, "frames") and hasattr(spinner, "interval"):
 468             if not spinner.frames or not spinner.interval:
 469                 sp = default_spinner
 470             else:
 471                 sp = spinner
 472         else:
 473             sp = default_spinner
 474 
 475         return sp
 476 
 477     @staticmethod
 478     def _set_side(side):
 479         # type: (str) -> str
 480         if side not in ("left", "right"):
 481             raise ValueError(
 482                 "'{0}': unsupported side value. "
 483                 "Use either 'left' or 'right'."
 484             )
 485         return side
 486 
 487     @staticmethod
 488     def _set_frames(spinner, reversal):
 489         # type: (base_spinner.Spinner, bool) -> Union[str, List]
 490         uframes = None  # unicode frames
 491         uframes_seq = None  # sequence of unicode frames
 492 
 493         if isinstance(spinner.frames, basestring):
 494             uframes = to_unicode(spinner.frames) if PY2 else spinner.frames
 495 
 496         # TODO (pavdmyt): support any type that implements iterable
 497         if isinstance(spinner.frames, (list, tuple)):
 498 
 499             # Empty ``spinner.frames`` is handled by ``Yaspin._set_spinner``
 500             if spinner.frames and isinstance(spinner.frames[0], bytes):
 501                 uframes_seq = [to_unicode(frame) for frame in spinner.frames]
 502             else:
 503                 uframes_seq = spinner.frames
 504 
 505         _frames = uframes or uframes_seq
 506         if not _frames:
 507             # Empty ``spinner.frames`` is handled by ``Yaspin._set_spinner``.
 508             # This code is very unlikely to be executed. However, it's still
 509             # here to be on a safe side.
 510             raise ValueError(
 511                 "{0!r}: no frames found in spinner".format(spinner)
 512             )
 513 
 514         # Builtin ``reversed`` returns reverse iterator,
 515         # which adds unnecessary difficulty for returning
 516         # unicode value;
 517         # Hence using [::-1] syntax
 518         frames = _frames[::-1] if reversal else _frames
 519 
 520         return frames
 521 
 522     @staticmethod
 523     def _set_interval(spinner):
 524         # Milliseconds to Seconds
 525         return spinner.interval * 0.001
 526 
 527     @staticmethod
 528     def _set_cycle(frames):
 529         return itertools.cycle(frames)
 530 
 531     @staticmethod
 532     def _set_text(text):
 533         if PY2:
 534             return to_unicode(text)
 535         return text
 536 
 537     @staticmethod
 538     def _hide_cursor():
 539         cursor.hide_cursor()
 540 
 541     @staticmethod
 542     def _show_cursor():
 543         cursor.show_cursor()
 544 
 545     @staticmethod
 546     def _clear_line():
 547         sys.stdout.write(chr(27) + "[K")
